themes.label: Treaties and Agreements
themes.rationale: The text records a formal arbitration and settlement (krisis) between the cities of Temnos and Clazomenae, mediated by judges from Knidos to resolve wartime disputes and restore friendship.
themes.quote: κρ σις ν πεφ ναντο ο α ρεθ ντες [δικα]σ[τα τ ν] κνιδ ων [ο ς π τρεψαν τ ν δ]ιεξαγωγ ν ποι σασθαι

themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The document functions as an official legal decision or decree issued by the appointed judges to settle claims between two sovereign states.
themes.quote: δι κα κρ νομες διαλελ σθαι τ ς π λεις περ τ ν κατ τ[ μ π λεμ]ον γκλημ των

themes.label: Boundary Markers (Horoi)
themes.rationale: The dispute involves the movement of stelae and boundary markers that defined the limits of a sacred precinct (temenos).
themes.quote: τ ν σταλ ν τινας κιν ν τ ν πρ[οσοριζουσ] ν τ το ς θεο ς νατεθ ν τ μενος

themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The judgment addresses the violation of a sacred precinct (temenos) and the removal of ancestral religious property.
themes.quote: τ το ς θεο ς νατεθ ν τ μενος φαιρε σθαι δ[ κα το τεμ] νους τ π τρια

themes.label: Lists of Officials or Citizens
themes.rationale: The inscription lists the specific names of the foreign judges from Knidos who were selected to oversee the arbitration.
themes.quote: θαλ ς ξεν δοτος γησικρ της π θων [κ]αφισ δωρος [----]δωρος

rationale: The inscription is a significant record of interstate arbitration in the Hellenistic period. It details the resolution of grievances (egklemata) between Temnos and Clazomenae following a war. The Knidian judges emphasize the restoration of 'friendship and goodwill' (philia kai eunoia) and declare an amnesty (amnestia) for wartime actions. A specific part of the dispute concerns the boundaries of a sacred precinct, where one party was accused of moving boundary stelae and encroaching on land dedicated to the gods.
